alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 3:25PM PST until January 14 at 10:12AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Deer Creek at Roseburg affecting Douglas County. For the Deer Creek...including Roseburg, Roseburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Deer Creek at Roseburg. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Low-lying agricultural flooding is occurring. Residential flooding begins at this point. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:52 PM PST Saturday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 10.1 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 4.1 feet by Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 4.8 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall to 4.0 feet Saturday, January 20. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 01/14/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM PST.
